net.kuujo.copycat

Interface Query<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Operation<T>, Serializable

    public interface Query<T>
extends Operation<T>
    Raft state queries read system state.

    Queries are submitted by clients to a Raft instance to read Raft cluster-wide state. In contrast to commands, queries allow for more flexible consistency levels that trade consistency for performance.

    All queries must specify a consistency() with which to execute the query. The provided consistency level dictates how queries are submitted to the Raft cluster. Higher consistency levels like ConsistencyLevel.LINEARIZABLE and ConsistencyLevel.LINEARIZABLE_LEASE are forwarded to the cluster leader, while lower levels are allowed to read from followers for higher throughput.

    By default, all queries should use the strongest consistency level, ConsistencyLevel.LINEARIZABLE. It is essential that users understand the trade-offs in the various consistency levels before using them.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman
    See Also:
    ConsistencyLevel

      ConsistencyLevel consistency()
      Returns the query consistency level.

      • Methods inherited from interface net.kuujo.copycat.Operation

        builder

    • Method Detail

      • consistency

        ConsistencyLevel consistency()
        Returns the query consistency level.

        The consistency will dictate how the query is executed on the server state. Stronger consistency levels can guarantee linearizability in all or most cases, while weaker consistency levels trade linearizability for more performant reads from followers. Consult the ConsistencyLevel documentation for more information on the different consistency levels.

        Returns:
        The query consistency level.
